text:
Hello Folks,  I am having a query regarding  React.js Framework.
Can we use React.js in HubSpot CMS?
If Yes, I would be grateful to you If you could Provide any resources related to react for HubSpot CMS.
Yes you can. You can not develop it in the CMS itself. But if you are using the local dev beta, you can use webpack etc. to use React
We build this boilerplate. You can easily switch Preact to React

If I edit a module that is in use on live pages, how will the pages be affected? Is user input to the fields in the editor somehow attached to the field or to field name? So if I change the internal name of the field, is data lost? I guess I can test this fairly quickly, but maybe others are interested as well

Heya <@UCGBUH5TM>!

Changing the internal name of the field will lose all content dependent on that field.

If you change the field default content, it won't update pages where that's already been edited.
Thanks <@UBFA10FMF>! You mean dependent in terms of e.g. conditional logic in the HubL or will content be lost if i add a display condition for the field itself?

By dependent, I mean any values in that field set from the page editors.
A display condition will be totally fine- content won't be lost. But if you were to change the hubl variable name, you would lose all the content.

Has anyone ever created something that would allow users to read a page for so long and then a form pops up (Custom Design, not using Lead Flows) and they can only continue reading if they enter their email on the pop up form?
It's importing another template that has the logo and navigation.
It's the free version of Launch Liftoff by BBS on the Marketplace.
Thought starting with a coded template would save time. Now I'm not so sure.
